channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15381] Implement a distributed MOB compaction by procedure
item.description: In MOB, there is a periodical compaction which runs in HMaster (It can be disabled by configuration), some small mob files are merged into bigger ones. Now the compaction only runs in HMaster which is not efficient and might impact the running of HMaster. In this JIRA, a distributed MOB compaction is introduced, it is triggered by HMaster, but all the compaction jobs are distributed to HRegionServers.
item.summary: Implement a distributed MOB compaction by procedure

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment: Ya we need this very much.. Doing all MOB compaction IO within single process HM is not good. +1 for the task.
Jingcheng Du ".... might impact the running of HMaster..." Can you say more?

Sure Stack.
Now in mob, we have a periodically run mob compaction, it can be disabled by setting the periodical value as -1.
In this compaction, small mob files (the threshold can be configured by users) are collected and grouped. The groups are compacted one by one by HMaster. There will be additional I/O between HMaster and HDFS DNs.
In this JIRA, all of these work will be distributed to region servers.

In this JIRA, all of these work will be distributed to region servers.

How you see it working Jingcheng Du? Thanks. What happens when compactions get backed up? The master is currently reading all small mob files and writing out new bigger ones? What do you see when this is going on? A master that lags burdened down by all the i/o? Thanks.
Yes MOB files compaction for all the MOB files across all regions will be done at single process, the HM.. It will be heavy IO there.. And the locality, whatever % it was there , will be all lost !!

What do you see when this is going on? A master that lags burdened down by all the i/o?

There will be heavy I/O between the node where HM resides and data nodes of HDFS. It might impact the network latency between HM and RS. And like what Anoop said, the locality will be lost after the compaction. I try to address such issues in new implementation.

How you see it working? What happens when compactions get backed up?

In the distributed compaction, the compaction is periodically triggered by HM, and the job is distributed to all RS by procedure, each RS will find the files belong to it and distribute them to online regions.
The mob compaction in each region compact small files in batches.

  1. Merge small files into a bigger one. (hopefully this big file won't be merged again from then on).
  2. bulkload the hfile which contains the meta cells (reference cells) to HBase.
    Then the new data are visible to users. Any exception occurs during each batch will trigger a rollback of compaction.
Upload the design for review.

For step 2:

record the mapping <regionServer, regions> in Zookeeper.

Have you considered other persistence medium ? We should reduce reliance on zookeeper.

For step 8:

Check if all found regions in this region server that are recorded in Zookeeper before the procedure is started are still online,

What if some regions are transitioned offline during the compaction process ?

adding a new item to metadata is a more reasonable choice

And this is amenable to compatibility.

What if duration of MOB compaction is longer than the interval which ScheduledChore runs ?

The distributed MOB compaction can be implemented in HBase procedure.

Please clarify whether proc V2 would be used.

Jingcheng:
Can you clarify the relationship between distributed MOB compaction and the current MOB sweeper tool ?

Thanks

Thanks Ted Yu.
Sweep tool is a tool, and distributed mob compaction is a compaction mechanism that runs periodically in the cluster.
Sweep tool uses MapReduce, it is distributed to RSs by mapper and reducer, and this tool scans all the mob table and merges the linked small files. ( cells in HBase -> mob files).
Distributed mob compaction uses procedure, and distributed to RSs by procedure too. It directly handles the mob files and merges the small files into bigger ones, at last adds the new reference cells back to hbase by bulk load. (mob files -> cells in HBase).
Sweeper is "cells in HBase" -> mob files, and mob compaction is "mob files -> cells in HBase), two different directions.
And I think if the distributed mob compaction is committed, the sweep tool can be removed from the code.
Update the design doc v2, it uses the rpc instead of zookeeper in the communication between the master and region servers.
Upload the first patch.

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.

Patch is 250KB

Can you put it on review board ?

we cannot predict the length of the file name in this way

The length of encoded region name is known, right ?
The filename wouldn't be too long if we replace MD5 with encoded region name.

+message GetMobCompactRegionsRequest {

GetMobCompactRegionsRequest -> GetMobCompactionRegionsRequest
Similar change to the response message name.


+  required string table_name = 1;

Please use TableName instead of string.


+      builder.addAllRegionStartKey(regionStartKeys);

addAllRegionStartKey -> addAllRegionStartKeys

+ */

+public class MasterMobCompactionManager extends MasterProcedureManager implements Stoppable {

Add annotation for audience.


+  private static final String MOB_COMPACTION_TIMEOUT_MILLIS_KEY =

+    "hbase.mob.compaction.master.timeoutMillis";

Looking at other configs, the key should be named hbase.master.mob.compaction.timeoutMillis
Same with hbase.mob.compaction.master.wakeMillis config name.


+  private Map<TableName, Map<String, Pair<Boolean, List<String>>>> compactingRegions =

Please add comment for what the String and Boolean mean.


+  private HMaster master;

Can we narrow the type so that HMaster is not referenced directly ?


+    Configuration copyOfConf = new Configuration(conf);

+    copyOfConf.setBoolean(CacheConfig.CACHE_DATA_ON_READ_KEY, Boolean.FALSE);

Maybe check the value for CacheConfig.CACHE_DATA_ON_READ_KEY . If it is false already, there is no need to copy.


+  public void updateAsMajorCompaction(TableName tableName, String serverName) {

...

+    regions.setFirst(Boolean.TRUE);

Consider using an eum in place of the boolean - it would make the code more readable.

+      } catch (IOException e) {

+        LOG.error("Failed to perform the mob compaction", e);

The IOE is swallowed ?


+        } catch (IOException e) {

+          LOG.error("Failed to mark end of mob compation", e);

Include table name in message.

For doCompaction() :


+        boolean isAllFiles = dispatchMobCompaction(tableName, column, allFiles);

isAllFiles has slightly different meaning from allFiles. Consider renaming it to make the code easier to understand.


+      } catch (Exception e) {

Catching IOE is not enough ?


+          if (hri.isOffline() && (hri.isSplit() || hri.isSplitParent())) {

+            allRegionsOnline = false;

Checking hri.isOffline() is not enough ?

Right. the length of the encoded name is known. It is a MD5 of the region name, it is similar with what is used in MOB now (MD5 of a start key).
Do we need to replace it?

Thanks a lot for the comments Ted Yu.

private HMaster master; Can we narrow the type so that HMaster is not referenced directly ?

I am afraid not. We have some specific invocations of HMaster.

regions.setFirst(Boolean.TRUE); Consider using an eum in place of the boolean - it would make the code more readable.

Agree. How about to add comments for this to help understand?

All the other comments will be addressed in the new patches and I will upload it to RB too. Thanks.
Update the patches according Ted's comments. Thanks.

There can be N partition group for one region. Pls mention whether these N compact ops will be serial or parallel and how those gets executed using a thread pool.
Also pls mention E2E flow like how we will update the ref cells with new path.
Submit the patch again.
You can find the patch in RB by https://reviews.apache.org/r/46479/. Thanks!
Will add such things to the design document. Thanks a lot.

w.r.t. Anoop's questions, if the answer is not given in chart, please put the words on JIRA as well.

When I replaced HMaster with MasterServices in HMasterMobCompactionStatusService, the only compilation error was with master.mobCompactionManager.

You can add a getter in MasterServices for MasterMobCompactionManager (to be renamed MobCompactionManager).

This way, declaring the field as MasterServices should suffice.

Thanks for the comments Anoop Sam John and Ted Yu!

bq Anoop's questions, if the answer is not given in chart, please put the words on JIRA as well.
Will update the document later.

You can add a getter in MasterServices for MasterMobCompactionManager (to be renamed MobCompactionManager).

This manager is not used for RPC calls (only for local reference and local call), is it okay to add it to MasterServices?

is it okay to add it to MasterServices?

Yes. MasterServices is different from MasterRpcServices.
Upload the new patch V3 to address Ted's comments. Thanks!
